Header: El Salvador to transfer 'big chunk' of bitcoin to physical vault
El Salvador to transfer 'big chunk' of bitcoin to physical vault
Content: In September 2021, El Salvador became the first country in the world to establish bitcoin as legal tender, earning it harsh criticism. One of the strongest critics was the International Monetary Fund, which has been negotiating a large loan with the cash-poor country. As he prepares to enter his second term as president, ground has yet to be broken on this so-called Bitcoin City. SAN SALVADOR (Reuters) -El Salvador will transfer "a big chunk" of its bitcoin assets to an offline device that will be stored in physical vault within the Central American country's territory, President Nayib Bukele said on Thursday.
